Last Month

Kevin Swiber

  • Thu, Nov 11, 2021 - Absolutely love @AsyncAPISpec. A fantastic model of community coming together and succeeding with full integrity and transparency. 💜 https://t.co/sboAVvGPwc
  • Tue, Nov 09, 2021 - For static sites, I was using Zola (https://t.co/ZH117HnmQi, written in Rust) for a while. I'm now using Node.js-based static site generators. And while I love them, my lack of build-time patience is paaaaainful. 😩
  • Mon, Nov 08, 2021 - @apievangelist I don't know of a live, running sandbox. I think that would require user-specific sandboxes that expire and are airtight in terms of vulnerabilities like container escape. There are open source projects one could _not_ run in prod: https://t.co/svLsCJ8PXe
  • Mon, Nov 08, 2021 - And if you're not out here tryna get blindsided by API-First: https://t.co/VUm39jEiSM
  • Mon, Nov 08, 2021 - This is such a great series by @dret. I love reports regarding developer productivity. @libel_vox touches on the trend of API-first. https://t.co/oK0HOsomgg
  • Mon, Nov 08, 2021 - Hyperfocus has led to every career win in my professional history. Also, I can be a one-person band cross-functionally, with all the flaws and benefits that come with that (a whole ass topic). I prefer working with teams, though. Collaboration makes my heart smile.
  • Mon, Nov 08, 2021 - I switch job responsibilities pretty frequently. I get to a level of comfort where I can produce at a perceived high quality while being less invested personally. Then I switch. It just occurred to me that I can attribute this to neurodivergence. 🤔
  • Thu, Nov 04, 2021 - @TheMarkONeill @dret @apihandyman @kinlane @jeanqasaur Sorry, friends. None of these have the portmanteau pizzazz of "infotainment".
  • Thu, Nov 04, 2021 - If you haven’t seen these livestreams, now is the time. They’re a wonderful part of my work week. https://t.co/fsfma9U4o9
  • Thu, Nov 04, 2021 - Overwhelmed by all the fluff around API-First? Here's what to do if you're a developer! https://t.co/VUm39jEiSM
  • Wed, Nov 03, 2021 - I don’t even understand how a 2-pizza team figures out the “correct” toppings. @libel_vox on why there’s isn’t one blueprint to rule them all. https://t.co/zWsMlM1uYB
  • Mon, Nov 01, 2021 - Some interesting DSLs supported by the KrakenD (@devopsfaith) API Gateway: - Martian DSL (https://t.co/mpNtZUPTVX) Configuration language for message transformation. - CEL (https://t.co/N5guL88OEh) Expression evaluation language for message validation.
  • Sat, Oct 30, 2021 - The scatter-gather pattern in the API Gateway was the precursor to the Backend-for-Frontend pattern. The former is _still_ a viable option often at lower cost.
  • Sat, Oct 30, 2021 - In 2012, I co-presented a Webinar we called The New 3-Tier Architecture. It has been almost 10 years, and it’s incredible how much this still rings true. Frontend -> API Gateway -> APIs. https://t.co/ZmKbg14tog
  • Sat, Oct 30, 2021 - When we talk about API-first, it’s more than just domain modeling. We are building networked applications, distributed systems. The contracts are influenced by the architecture. It’s the combination of multiple disciplines that make this successful.
  • Sat, Oct 30, 2021 - We could probably do a meaningful breakdown of different technologies using these thoughts as a guide. What’s the impact of GraphQL vs an API with materialized views? How much behavior should move to the client-server interface given evolution requirements? And so on.
  • Sat, Oct 30, 2021 - It’s important to understand this when designing your data transfer mechanism—the API. What compromises will you make on state ownership, storage, and compute?
  • Mon, Oct 25, 2021 - I'm trying to get a handle on @webMethods_io API Gateway for a gateway research project I'm doing. Anyone have experience with this? Software AG offers an awful lot, and I'm getting lost in the docs.
  • Sat, Oct 23, 2021 - @taylor_atx Regional conferences often depend on sponsorship from local tech companies. This floods the conference with vendor talks and may homogenize it with the bulk of attendees being employed by sponsors.
  • Sat, Oct 23, 2021 - @taylor_atx This is a very thoughtful take. So, here’s my experience. For API Craft Conference 2013, we capped it at 150. We went all-in on an Open Space Technology approach. To this day, I hear from people about how it was the best experience. Transparent sponsors were a huge part of that.
